Description.val: The family of 40mm cartridges consists of low velocity single rounds designed to be fired from the M203 and M32 grenade launchers, as well as high velocity linked rounds designed to be fired from the MK19, 40mm grenade machine gun.  Cartridges fired from the M203 and M32 grenade launchers include signaling and marking rounds, a CS (o-chlorobenzamalono-nitrile) round, training and practice Day/ Night marker rounds, and a light Armor Piercing and Anti-Personnel Dual Purpose (HEDP) rounds. Cartridges fired from the MK19 include light Armor Piercing and HEDP rounds and a Day/ Night marker, target practice training round.

Justification.val:
FY 2017 baseline funding will procure the 40mm Target Practice linked cartridge, Day/Night Marker, MK281 MOD3.  These cartridges have been expended by Marine Forces during preparation, rehearsals and training engagements utilizing established tactics, techniques, and procedures.  Additionally, in response to a range clearing mishap where Un-Exploded Ordnance (UXO) detonated resulting in fatalities, HQ Marine Corps mandated a reduction in the use of high explosive rounds during training.  This resulted directly in the increase to the Marine Corps' FY 2017 inventory requirement and procurement of 40mm Target Practice Linked rounds.

OCO: 
FY 2017 OCO funding will be used to reset munitions expended in support of Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF)/ Operation Freedom's Sentinel (OFS).

Remarks.val:
[Hardware] There was a congressional reduction in FY15 Baseline funding to B542 for LAP Kit Cost Growth.
There was a congressional reduction in FY16 Baseline funding to B542 for Excess Production Engineering.

Name.@footnote: 40MM HEDP Linked - LAP contract for FY 2015 will be a part of the FY15 Systems Contract and will award in Jun 2016.  Award date slipped from Sep 2015 to Jun 2016 due to cancelation of the original contract.  A new procurement package leading to contract award is currently in process for award in Jun 2016.
